qas.question: How have Arsenal players portrayed in media?
In what decades were Arsenal players stereotyped in a negative way?
What film featured a Arsenal play in  derogatory way?
Which comic made numerous jokes about Arsenal players?
What film uses characters named after Arsenal full backs?
In what year did the movie Plunkett & Macleane release?
Who are two of the characters in The Full Monty?
In what year did Lee Dixon join Arsenal?
In what year was Nigel Winterburn's last game with Arsenal?

context: Arsenal have often been stereotyped as a <a0_0>defensive and "boring"<a0_0/> side, especially during the <a1_0>1970s and 1980s<a1_0/>; many comedians, such as <a3_0><b9_0>Eric Morecambe<b9_0/><a3_0/>, made jokes about this at the team's expense. The theme was repeated in the <b5_0><b7_0><b8_0>1997<b8_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/> film <a2_0>The Full Monty<a2_0/>, in a scene where the lead actors move in a line and raise their hands, deliberately mimicking the Arsenal defence's offside trap, in an attempt to co-ordinate their striptease routine. Another film reference to the club's defence comes in the film <a4_0>Plunkett & Macleane<a4_0/>, in which two characters are named <b6_0>Dixon and Winterburn<b6_0/> after Arsenal's long-serving full backs – the right-sided Lee Dixon and the left-sided Nigel Winterburn.
